title: Champion Idea - Eris the Lost Summoner
body:
A few friends and myself had an idea for a new champion based around a summoner and came up with this basic idea we need everyone's help to make this cooler, more playable and hopefully a reality

Name: Eris the Lost Summoner

Lore: a new and upcoming summoner got bored with the current summoning style and experimented with different techniques leading to her being trapped in a rift between the Runeterra and the fields of justice, when she returned she was shunned and removed from the facility, joining the once controlled champions to prove her new knowledge and return to the world of summoners

Health:
490 (+80 per level)
Mana:
320 (+60 per level)
Attack Damage:
48 (+3 per level)
Attack Speed:
0.6 (+2% per level)
Movement Speed:
335
Health Regen:
5.6 (+0.6 per level)
Mana Regen:
8 (+0.8 per level)
Armor:
21 (+3.3 per level)
Magic Resist:
30 (+0 per level)

Passive - ethereal - starts game with a single use of "R" to place first gate and allows 3 uses of the gate while active

Q - duel summon - creates a mirror image of target Allie randomly placed to either their left or right side, copies all actions and visual effects and has own heath bar that can be hurt and healed (eg. mundo's r would cause both mundo and mirror to heal) however mirror can not damage and appears grey to allied team or when viewed by oracles ect. duration 1/1.5/2/2.5/3 seconds + 1 second per 200 Ap

W - distorted field - AOE causing initial damage of 20/40/60/80/100 +40%Ap to MANA and 1/2/3/4/5% per second damage to current health (field size slightly increases with rank)

E - Forced disconnect - deals 50/100/150/200/250 +30%Ap and causes target to run back to base as if D/C'd for 1/1.25/1.5/1.75/2 seconds

R - Rift Gate - Channels for 1.5 seconds before creating a gate (must be placed with range of previous gate) the linked gates create a passage usable by ALL for 6 seconds and can be used from either end, upon using the gate the champion receives a debuff preventing use for 10 seconds enemies recieve 1/3/5% max hp damage in addition to the debuff, at the end of the spell the older gate is destroyed increased ranks increases maximum distance between gates
gates can not be destroyed and produce no line of sight 

cooldowns and mana costs would need to be worked on to balance

Ps. i know this is also located in miscellaneous i mistakenly selected the wrong choice from the drop down box

replies.body: there are summoners at the institute of war that are not people playing a game in Fiddlesticks lore it states "Decades ago, there existed a powerful rune mage from Zaun - Istvaan. At the end of the fifth Rune War, he became one of the League's first summoners." and this person existed in there world. We have simply taken this theory to create a champion with an origin linking to the institute of war itself instead of a city, country or the previously other explored locations (void, shadow isles, ect.)

As far as I know and that may not be very far, but as far as I know summoners cannot have a direct impact to the balance of a tribunal judgement taking place (or more commonly known as a match). They just aren't magically wired that way, it would be like having one guy whose only impactful power is to bring (or summon) another guy unto the field while the first guy (ie the summoner) is in direct danger of dying himself, and god knows what would happen if the summoner would die and then the guy he summoned died as well, so then he cant summon him back to life.
It makes my head spin but you get the point im sure

Very cool concept, just a bit of confusion on my part - what do you mean by her passive allowing 3 uses of the gate? In fact, if you could generally explain her passive a bit more to me that'd be great, as I'm feeling dumb and don't get it.

Q - Very cool and different idea, would be like Leblanc passive but flashier, though wouldn't it be a bit obvious to anyone currently looking at the target? (or perhaps thats part of the nature of the ability, I'm not sure :) )

W - Nice ability, the instant mana burn is interesting and it seems like a good idea that you didn't make it entirely mana-burn based with the HP damage

E - Fairly basic ability, targeted damage with a somewhat predictable version of a fear, which makes it interesting for followup. I'm guessing they can't cast spells etc. while affected?

R - A nice ultimate - like Reksai tunnels for everyone - a couple of questions:

When the spell ends, does the new gate stick around? And does it get rid of the gate created off passive?
The max HP damage seems a bit low - DFG deals 15% max hp damage for reference - don't be afraid of ramping it up a bit to make your enemies think twice about using it.
Does the gate(s) block movement?

OK lets start with the "R" since that works with the passive.
the gate u begin play with is so u can get an anchor or midpoint for the ability. the gate itself cannot be harmed however dose not prevent movement (similar to a thresh lantern) and produces no sight (so no permanent wards) when the "R" is off cooldown u can place a new gate so long as it is not more the x distance from the old gate, when placed both the old and the new gate have effects so people know it is active an when walked to and clicked they get warped to the other gate. so champion "A" is on your team they warp and get a debuff so they cant turn around and use it again during this cast, champion "B" an enemy uses the gate with the same effect and same debuff as well as damage because enemy, and "C" Eris uses the gate she can warp there turn around and go back through it and come back again (3 uses) before receiving the debuff. after the spell ends the old gate disappears and the new gate becomes the new center point of the spell, i held back the damage because of the powerful utility of the spell but as with everything in a work in progress it could be tweaked to make it more risky. 

so Q, it would depend on the animation i perceived a smoke like effect to obscure the champion so u don't know however making it realizable to those who are observant might not be a bad thing either

E, yep similar to fiddlesticks fear all u can do is watch and laugh or cry

Interesting concept... I'm assuming by "all" you mean champions only and not minions being able to use the rift gate. Love the mana burn idea - I've talked about that with a bunch of friends along with various sabotage abilities like being able to buff dragon/baron

yeah the character is biased around tactical control and targeted sabotage, things that don't do heaps of damage but allow u to manipulate the game. oh and yes by ALL we did mean all champions both on your and the enemy team but yeah "no minions allowed" lol
